Key Match Events: The Mavericks missed five of their last six shots and had one possession end in a turnover.
Steph Curry nailed a three-pointer with 27.5 seconds left and that was the end of the discussion.
Luka Dončić had the ball and the shot clock was winding down. He tried a turnaround fadeaway from the free-throw line and missed.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Jason Kidd emphasized the importance of being better as a team and that the loss to Golden State was a great test.
Luka Dončić said he is still adjusting to playing off the ball more this season and that it's getting better and better.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Jason Kidd said that the Mavericks got better tonight, even though they lost, and that there were a lot of positive things.
Luka Dončić said he's still adjusting and that it's way different this year with a lot of depth on the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors are rolling and have found a defensive-minded starting unit featuring Trayce Jackson-Davis and De'Anthony Melton, along with Draymond Green, Andrew Wiggins and Curry.
The centers were back to normal, with Daniel Gafford and Dereck Lively II tag-teaming the entire game.
Quentin Grimes went from not playing at Denver to 29 effective minutes against the Warriors and did a real good job defensively.
Others: The Mavericks are still feeling their way along with Klay Thompson in the starting lineup alongside Kyrie Irving and Luka Dončić.
Luka Dončić was walking gingerly after the game, but simply said 'I'm fine' when asked what's ailing him.
